trans-unit.source: Create a NoSQL DocumentDB database | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create a NoSQL DocumentDB database | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create managed databases using the online service portal for Azure DocumentDB, a NoSQL document database for JSON.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create managed databases using the online service portal for Azure DocumentDB, a NoSQL document database for JSON.

trans-unit.source: Get a free trial today.
trans-unit.target: Get a free trial today.

trans-unit.source: Create a DocumentDB database using the Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: Create a DocumentDB database using the Azure preview portal

trans-unit.source: To use Microsoft Azure DocumentDB, you must have a [DocumentDB account](documentdb-create-account.md), a database, a collection, and documents.
trans-unit.target: To use Microsoft Azure DocumentDB, you must have a [DocumentDB account](documentdb-create-account.md), a database, a collection, and documents.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to create a DocumentDB database in the Microsoft Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to create a DocumentDB database in the Microsoft Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: Databases do not have to be created using the preview portal, you can also create them using the [DocumentDB SDKs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781482.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Databases do not have to be created using the preview portal, you can also create them using the [DocumentDB SDKs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781482.aspx).

trans-unit.source: For a C# code sample showing how to create a database using the DocumentDB .NET SDK, see the [Program.cs](https://github.com/Azure/azure-documentdb-net/blob/master/samples/code-samples/DatabaseManagement/Program.cs) file in the DatabaseManagement project, available in the [azure-documentdb-net](https://github.com/Azure/azure-documentdb-net) repository on [GitHub.com](https://github.com).
trans-unit.target: For a C# code sample showing how to create a database using the DocumentDB .NET SDK, see the [Program.cs](https://github.com/Azure/azure-documentdb-net/blob/master/samples/code-samples/DatabaseManagement/Program.cs) file in the DatabaseManagement project, available in the [azure-documentdb-net](https://github.com/Azure/azure-documentdb-net) repository on [GitHub.com](https://github.com).

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com/), click **Browse all**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure preview portal](https://portal.azure.com/), click **Browse all**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Browse** blade, click **DocumentDB Accounts**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Browse** blade, click **DocumentDB Accounts**.

trans-unit.source: In the **DocumentDB Accounts** blade, select the account in which to add a DocumentDB database.
trans-unit.target: In the **DocumentDB Accounts** blade, select the account in which to add a DocumentDB database.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have any accounts listed, you'll need to [create a DocumentDB account](documentdb-create-account.md).
trans-unit.target: If you don't have any accounts listed, you'll need to [create a DocumentDB account](documentdb-create-account.md).

trans-unit.source: Screen shot highlighting the Browse button, DocumentDB Accounts on the Browse blade, and a DocumentDB account on the DocumentDB Accounts blade
trans-unit.target: Screen shot highlighting the Browse button, DocumentDB Accounts on the Browse blade, and a DocumentDB account on the DocumentDB Accounts blade

trans-unit.source: In the **DocumentDB Account** blade, click **Add Database**.
trans-unit.target: In the **DocumentDB Account** blade, click **Add Database**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add Database** blade, enter the ID for your new database.
trans-unit.target: In the **Add Database** blade, enter the ID for your new database.

trans-unit.source: When the name is validated, a green check mark appears in the ID box.
trans-unit.target: When the name is validated, a green check mark appears in the ID box.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** at the bottom of the screen to create the new database.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** at the bottom of the screen to create the new database.

trans-unit.source: Screen shot highlighting the Add Database button on the DocumentDB Account blade, the ID box on the Add Database blade, and the OK button
trans-unit.target: Screen shot highlighting the Add Database button on the DocumentDB Account blade, the ID box on the Add Database blade, and the OK button

trans-unit.source: The new database now appears in the **Databases** lens on the **DocumentDB Account** blade.
trans-unit.target: The new database now appears in the **Databases** lens on the **DocumentDB Account** blade.

trans-unit.source: Screen shot of the new database in the DocumentDB Account blade
trans-unit.target: Screen shot of the new database in the DocumentDB Account blade

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you have a DocumentDB database, the next step is to [create a collection](documentdb-create-collection.md).
trans-unit.target: Now that you have a DocumentDB database, the next step is to [create a collection](documentdb-create-collection.md).

trans-unit.source: Once your collection is created, you can [add documents](../documentdb-view-json-document-explorer.md) by using the Document Explorer in the preview portal, [import documents](documentdb-import-data.md) into the collection by using the DocumentDB Data Migration Tool, or use one of the [DocumentDB SDKs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781482.aspx) to perform CRUD operations.
trans-unit.target: Once your collection is created, you can [add documents](../documentdb-view-json-document-explorer.md) by using the Document Explorer in the preview portal, [import documents](documentdb-import-data.md) into the collection by using the DocumentDB Data Migration Tool, or use one of the [DocumentDB SDKs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781482.aspx) to perform CRUD operations.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB has .NET, Java, Python, Node.js, and JavaScript API SDKs.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB has .NET, Java, Python, Node.js, and JavaScript API SDKs.

trans-unit.source: For .NET code samples showing how to create, remove, update and delete documents, see [Program.cs](https://github.com/Azure/azure-documentdb-net/blob/master/samples/code-samples/DocumentManagement/Program.cs) in the DocumentManagement project in the azure-documentdb-net repository on GitHub.com.
trans-unit.target: For .NET code samples showing how to create, remove, update and delete documents, see [Program.cs](https://github.com/Azure/azure-documentdb-net/blob/master/samples/code-samples/DocumentManagement/Program.cs) in the DocumentManagement project in the azure-documentdb-net repository on GitHub.com.

trans-unit.source: After you have documents in a collection, you can use [DocumentDB SQL](documentdb-sql-query.md) to [execute queries](documentdb-sql-query.md#executing-queries) against your documents by using the [Query Explorer](documentdb-query-collections-query-explorer.md) in the preview portal, the [REST API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781481.aspx), or one of the [SDKs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781482.aspx).
trans-unit.target: After you have documents in a collection, you can use [DocumentDB SQL](documentdb-sql-query.md) to [execute queries](documentdb-sql-query.md#executing-queries) against your documents by using the [Query Explorer](documentdb-query-collections-query-explorer.md) in the preview portal, the [REST API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781481.aspx), or one of the [SDKs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn781482.aspx).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
